Every May or June, the Gharbi -- the seasonal western wind that sweeps through the empty quarter of the Arabian Peninsula -- blows a reservoir of very dry air out towards the Arabian Sea in the direction of India during its monsoon season. Researchers at NYUAD's Center for Prototype Climate Modeling are trying to find out.
